title: Grub Multiboot ISO troubleshooting help wanted

forumNotes.author: Alloishus
forumNotes.content:
My intent is to create a Bootable USB drive that will allow me to select many .isos.   

I have found and followed the directions at [http://www.pendrivel...b-multiboot-usb](http://www.pendrivelinux.com/boot-multiple-iso-from-usb-multiboot-usb "External link"), several times on the same USB device.   

I understand different ISOs need different menu.lst options.   

So, my problem...........................  

I tested this on two different systems, 1. Ubuntu Asus netbook 2. HP Windows Desktop.   

So, scenario 1:  
On the Ubuntu netbook, I have it set to boot from USB as 1st device, and have the internal hard drive disabled.  

The USB drive boots, apparently from the USB device. I get the grub prompt, and I have to type in root (fd0). At this point I get the correct menu, splash screen, and can select and boot my ISOs.  

Scenario 2:  
Same boot setup as above, but with no option to disable hard drive (like in Asus BIOS). However, apparently it boots from the USB drive, I get the grub prompt, but when I do "root (\<TAB\>", I get Error 25: Device Read Error.   

I cannot figure out how it can boot from the device, and then not be able to read from it. I am not able to find any devices at this point.   

Any help with either/or situation would be awesome. I can wipe out the USB drive as much as needed.  

Regards,  

- Allo.

forumNotes.author: Wonko the Sane
forumNotes.content:
HOW did you partition/format the USB stick? There are a lot of quirks in BIOS, it wouldn't be the first time that a "normal" (otherwise working) partitioning/formatting won't result in something actually booting properly as HD-like device on "peculiar" machines. My suggestions are: * try RMPREPUSB first, with the 2PTN option * if it doesn't work, try FBINST
Sticky in this same Forum: [http://www.boot-land...?showtopic=9460](http://www.boot-land.net/forums/index.php?showtopic=9460 "External link") Be aware that RMPREPUSB is (mostly) straightforward, FBINST is a bit more complex, if you run XP or similar NT based system you can use this batch to easen the install of FBINST: [http://www.boot-land...?...c=11463\&hl=](http://www.boot-land.net/forums/index.php?showtopic=11463&hl= "External link") ![:thumbsup:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/thumbsup.gif) Wonko

forumNotes.author: Alloishus
forumNotes.content:
The multibootISOx.exe has a checkbox for formatting. Just for completeness, I low level formatted the disk using HDDGuru Low Level Disk Formatter. Then I ran multibootisos.exe, and checked the box to format it with Fat32. I only need 1 partition as far as I can tell...But admittedly, the multibootISO.exe program might be doing something else.   

Thanks for those links and response. I'll try those and get back with results.

forumNotes.author: Alloishus
forumNotes.content:
Thanks Wonko.   

RMPREPUSB did the trick and all works in the world now.
